meanings.definition: To break off in small pieces
meanings.sent1: The old paint spalled off the wall in tiny bits.
meanings.sent2: The concrete spalled due to the harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The cookie spalled into crumbs as soon as I touched it.
meanings.sent4: Her heart spalled into a million pieces when she heard the news.
meanings.sent5: The fragile ice spalled under the weight of the skater.

meanings.sent1: The bark spalled from the tree trunk after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The metal spalled from the surface, revealing rust underneath.
meanings.sent3: The potato chip spalled into smaller pieces when I bit into it.
meanings.sent4: His confidence spalled away with each rejection he faced.
meanings.sent5: The paint on the door spalled off in patches, exposing the wood beneath.

meanings.definition: Broken or chipped off in small pieces
meanings.sent1: The spalled concrete pathway was uneven and rough to walk on.
meanings.sent2: The spalled pottery had sharp edges where it had broken off.
meanings.sent3: The spalled mirror reflected a fragmented image of the room.
meanings.sent4: The spalled rock formations created a jagged landscape.
meanings.sent5: The spalled wooden fence looked weathered and worn from years of exposure.
